grading.policies: Assignments and papers must be submitted on time; late submissions require prior approval.

assignments.description: Complete/update a student profile at the beginning of the course.
Ensure that team assignments are posted on time to the correct discussion group when serving as team leader.
Participate in the online discussion for each week.
Contribute weekly to the team project as assessed by other members of the team.
Read business book and prepare one term paper and post to Turnitin.
Complete the online course survey at the end of the course.

policies.attendance: Students are required to participate in weekly online discussions.
policies.late_work: Prior approval must be received for late assignments, which may affect earned points.
policies.academic_integrity: All students must adhere to the Graduate Student Code of Academic Integrity.
policies.accommodations: Stevens provides accommodations for students with documented disabilities.

additional_info.course_format: Weekly lectures, supplemental readings, quizzes, online discussions, term papers, team assignments, and a final team project.
additional_info.technology_requirements: Students must have a working external microphone and headset, a current Mac or PC, and required software including Microsoft Word, Excel, and PowerPoint.
additional_info.support_resources: Office of Counseling and Psychological Services (CAPS) offers free and confidential services.

_metadata.course_description: The course introduces students to the principles and processes of systems engineering.
learning_outcomes: Understand the need for good systems engineering up front and throughout the life cycle of the system.
Review and evaluate the various systems engineering models in use today.
Differentiate between the operational need and the system solution to be implemented.
Select from a wide range of system concepts as the first step in system design.
Derive quantitative system requirements that best meet the functions and performance requirements of the system.
Adopt a systems perspective when making decisions that affect performance or total ownership cost of the system.
